abstract_text: beryllium and oxygen abundances have been derived in a sample of f - type field stars for which lithium abundances had been measured previously , with the aim of obtaining observational constraints to discriminate between the different mixing mechanisms proposed . mixing associated with the transport of angular momentum in the stellar interior and internal gravity waves within the framework of rotating evolutionary models ,   appear to be promising ways to explain the observations .
article_text_summary: new beryllium and oxygen abundances are presented for a sample of slightly evolved f - type stars belonging to the old disk population .   a large scatter is found in the beryllium abundances , as well as in the correlation between beryllium and stellar mass .   a weak be - o correlation is observed , and most stars show oxygen abundances close to the solar value .   very similar results are obtained for the corresponding f - type stars of open clusters .   the observations are not easy to explain with the models available at present .   theoretical radiative accelerations do not reproduce the observed oxygen abundances and there is no clear evidence of the presence of a strong turbulence induced by internal gravity waves ( as observed in the sun ) which is able to induce a large be depletion .   a consistent explanation for the observations is not found with the rotating evolutionary models available at present .

abstract_text: we present a time - dependent solution of the maxwell equations in the einstein universe , whose electric and magnetic fields , as seen by the stationary observers , are aligned with the clifford parallels of the @xmath0-sphere @xmath1 .   the conformal equivalence between minkowski s spacetime and ( a region of ) the einstein cylinder is then exploited in order to obtain a knotted , finite energy , radiating solution of the maxwell equations in flat spacetime .   we also discuss similar electromagnetic fields in expanding closed friedmann models , and compute the matter content of such configurations .
article_text_summary: we find a solution of the maxwell equations in vacuum with the electric and magnetic fields aligned along the spatial geodesics of the cylinder , corresponding to a knotted configuration in minkowski s spacetime .   the spatial shape of the knot is a circle of constant radius r in space @xmath0 3; this circle is linked with the horizon @xmath1 , and the linking number is equal to one .   we show that this configuration represents a radiating system , and compute its finite energy e .   this solution is then extended to closed friedmann - lematre - robertson - walker models ; the corresponding spatial shape is a circle of constant proper length .   we also determine the electromagnetic energy e   in these universes , and show that it is a decreasing function of the scale factor a   .   finally , we find the matter distribution with stress - energy tensor diagonal in the orthonormal basis that makes the electromagnetic solution self - consistent with the einstein - maxwell equations .

article_text_summary: in models of the chemical evolution of galaxies , it is usual to assume that the stellar initial mass function ( imf ) is universal and constant in time and space .   new observations of the star forming regions in the local universe suggest that the most massive stars ( which dominate the production of many heavy elements ) may be far more common in extreme environments ( such as the interacting galaxies which presumably dominated the early universe ) than they are in the milky way today .   if the universality of the imf is in question , then this would have major implications for many areas of astrophysics .    we investigate the effects of imf variation on the chemical evolution of galaxies .   in particular we model the effect of changing the imf on the yields of oxygen and magnesium from type - ii supernovae .   we use a simple model in which we assume that the star formation rate is proportional to the gas mass , and we make the plausible but ad hoc assumption that a galaxy's ability to form very massive stars depends upon the mass of the galaxy .   we model galaxies of different masses assuming that the imf was different in the past .   we compare the predictions of our models with the observed and inferred @xmath0/fe and mg/fe ratios in the solar neighbourhood , the galactic bulge , the galactic halo , and in massive elliptical galaxies .   we find that the assumption that the imf was heavier in the early universe ( and in low metallicity dwarf galaxies ) and became lighter at some stage reproduces the observations and the inferences .   we show that an evolving imf may be a better fit to the observations in the solar neighbourhood than an evolving imf , but with different forms in different galaxies .   this may provide some support for the controversial suggestion that the imf is " top - heavy " in the central regions of the milky way .   our models   suggest that the imf is fairly " normal " in the galactic bulge .   a relativley heavy imf ( and/or perhaps a top - heavy imf ) with a form similar to that in the early universe would   be expected in large elliptical galaxies .   our results depend upon the details of the yields , but it is likely that some degree of imf variation is required to account for the @xmath0/fe and mg/fe ratios in galaxies of different types and masses .   they lend support to recent theoretical models which suggest that the imf is " heavier " in the early universe and in low metallicity dwarf galaxies .   an imf which is " normal " in the galactic bulge and " light " in the disk of the milky way may be in conflict with standard theories of star formation .  ,    galaxies : abundances , galaxies : elliptical and lenticular , cD , galaxies : evolution , galaxies : formation , galaxies : halos , galaxies : starburst , galaxies : the galaxy , stars : formation , stars : early - abstract_text: in this paper we report that a bright , x - ray source in the antennae galaxies ( ngc 4038/9 ) , previously identified as an ultra - luminous x - ray source , is in fact a background quasar .   we identify an isolated infrared and optical counterpart within @xmath0 the x - ray source x-37 . after acquiring   an optical spectrum of its counterpart , we use the narrow [ oiii ] and broad h@xmath1 emission lines to identify x-37 as a quasar at a redshift of z=0.26 . through a @xmath2 , @xmath3 , and @xmath4 photometric analysis ,   we demonstrate that most of the observable light along this line of sight is from the quasar .   we discuss the implications of this discovery and the importance of acquiring spectra for optical and ir counterparts to ulxs .
article_text_summary: during ground - based spectroscopic observations of the counterpart to the ultraluminous x - ray source x-37 in the antennae ( ngc 4038/4039 ) , we discovered that this object is a background quasar at a redshift of z=0.26 .   we discuss how this affects the methods used to identify x-37 as a ulx and the implications of this result on the conclusions drawn from the x - ray properties of this source .   while our study is based on a single object , it illustrates the importance of obtaining follow - up spectra of counterparts when studying ulx sources .

abstract_text: we show that a triple - product correlation in the neutron radiative @xmath0-decay rate , characterized by the kinematical variable @xmath1 , where @xmath2 , isolates the pseudo - chern - simons term found by harvey , hill , and hill as a consequence of the baryon vector current anomaly and su(2)@xmath3@xmath4u(1)@xmath5 gauge invariance at low energies .   the correlation appears if the imaginary part of the coupling constant is nonzero , so that its observation at anticipated levels of sensitivity would reflect the presence of sources of cp violation beyond the standard model .   we compute the size of the asymmetry in @xmath6 decay as a function of the coupling , estimate the effect of standard - model final - state interactions , and discuss the role nuclear processes can play in discovering the effect .      @xmath0-decay , decay correlations , cp violation    23.40.-s , 11.30.er , 12.39.fe , 12.15.-y
article_text_summary: qcd generates an axial anomaly whose electroweak gauge - boson content gives rise to interactions which are not characterized by the standard model ( sm ) parameters ; such interactions can induce a non - zero neutron electric dipole moment ( edm ) . it is difficult , however , to calculate the edm precisely because the effect is contaminated by typically large ( and model - dependent ) final - state interactions ( fsi ) in the neutron. we demonstrate that an appropriately designed experiment which studies the triple - product momentum correlation in radiative @xmath0-decay from the neutron can isolate the induced edm from the fsi background ; the edm from the quark chromo - edm interaction can then be extracted cleanly from the measured result.   a triple - product experiment of the sort we discuss would allow , for the first time , a precise calculation of the quark chromo - edm contribution to the neutron edm.

abstract_text: we report results from a program of high - resolution spectral mapping of rotational h@xmath0 emission from bipolar planetary and pre - planetary nebulae .   long - slit spectra obtained with the noao phoenix near - infrared spectrometer allow us to probe the molecular kinematics of these nebulae at moderate spatial resolution .   we find strong evidence of a component of rotation in the equatorial h@xmath0 emission from the egg nebula ( rafgl 2688 ) . in this nebula and   in the pre - planetary nebula rafgl 618 , the h@xmath0 kinematics point to the recent emergence of high - velocity polar flows , which likely mark the fairly sudden terminations of the red giant phases of their central stars .   the classical bipolar planetary ngc 2346 displays distinct kinematic components , which we interpret as arising in the morphologically distinct equatorial and polar regions of the nebula .   the h@xmath0 rings observed in the phoenix position - velocity maps of this nebula support the hypothesis that ring - like planetaries that display h@xmath0 emission possess bipolar structure .
article_text_summary: we have used the noao phoenix spectrometer to obtain high spectral resolution h@xmath0 velocity maps of the bipolar planetary nebula ngc 2346 and the pre - planetary nebulae rafgl 2688 and rafgl 618 .   these maps provide new information on the kinematics of molecular hydrogen emission regions which are spatially distinct from the polar lobes in these objects .      * assistant astronomer , stsci , 3700 san martin drive , baltimore , md 21218 ; weintraub@stsci .  * research associate , department of physics , rpi , troy , ny 12180 ; kastnj@rpi .  * astronomer , gsfc , code 668 , greenbelt , md 20771 ; brian . j . cox@gsfc .

abstract_text: the ams-02 experiment confirms the excess of positrons in cosmic rays ( crs ) for energy above 10 gev with respect to the secondary production of positrons in the interstellar medium .   this is interpreted as evidence of the existence of a primary source of these particles .   possible candidates are dark matter or astrophysical sources . in this work   we discuss the possible contribution due to pulsars and their nebulae .   our key assumption is that the primary spectrum of electrons and positrons at the source is the same of the well known photon spectrum observed from gamma - rays telescopes . using a diffusion model in the galaxy we propagate the source spectra up to the solar system .   we compare our results with the recent experiments and with the lis model .    to appear on the proceedings of the 14th icatpp conference on + astroparticle , particle , space physics and detectors + for physics applications , + villa olmo ( como , italy ) , 2327 october , 2013 , + to be published by world scientific ( singapore ) .
article_text_summary: the recent result of the ams-02 collaboration shows that the positron fraction in cosmic rays increases with the energy from @xmath0 to @xmath1 gev . models with only secondary production of positrons can not explain this result . it is necessary to introduce a primary source . pulsars and their nebulae can be a possible candidate . the high energy positrons , created by these sources , lose energy during their travel from the source to the solar system . this effect can reduce the positron flux at high energy and can help to reproduce the ams-02 data .   a propagation code ( galprop ) was used to estimate the fraction of positrons and electrons that comes from pulsars . the lis for electrons and positrons observed in cosmic rays from @xmath2 up to the tev region is compared with the results reported by the ams-02 experiment .   the lis can be reproduced introducing , as a primary source , the pulsars and their nebulae . with this model the positron fraction can be explained .   = ams-02 , cosmic rays , galprop , pulsars

abstract_text: saturation is expected to occur when a high density of partons ( mainly gluons)- or equivalently strong fields in quantum chromodynamics ( qcd ) - is realized in the weak coupling regime .   a way to reach saturation is through the high - energy evolution of an extended target probed at a fixed hard scale . in this case   , the transition to saturation is expected to occur from nonlinear perturbative qcd dynamics .   we discuss this approach to saturation , which is mathematically characterized by the appearance of traveling wave patterns in a suitable kinematical representation .   a short review on traveling waves in high energy qcd and a first evidence of this phenomenon in deep - inelastic proton scattering are presented .       address = service de physique thorique , cea / saclay , 91191 gif - sur - yvette cedex , france + ura 2306 , unit de recherche associe au cnrs
article_text_summary: one of the most intriguing empirical observations about deep - inelastic scattering ( dis ) on a proton is the geometric scaling property $ , which states that the $ total cross - section data can be approximately ploted on a one - dimensional curve $ where $ span the virtuality - rapidity kinematical domain of dis .   the question we want to address is whether the observed geometric scaling can be explained in terms of qcd evolution equations describing _ saturation _ .    and how can geometric scaling be related to the corresponding properties of the solutions of the balitsky - kovchegov equation ?      * an universality property of nonlinear equations allows one to relate geometric scaling to traveling wave solutions . *    [1cm]     e.  iancu      institut de physique thorique   cea / saclay   f - 91191 gif - sur - yvette cedex , france      and      laboratoire de physique thrique   universit paris xi   f - 91405 orsay cedex , france

abstract_text: an event - driven molecular dynamics simulation of inelastic hard spheres contained in a cylinder and subject to strong vibration reproduces accurately experimental results@xcite for a system of vibrofluidized glass beads .   in particular , we are able to obtain the velocity field and the density and temperature profiles observed experimentally . in addition   , we show that the appearance of convection rolls is strongly influenced by the value of the sidewall - particle restitution coefficient .   suggestions for observing more complex convection patterns are proposed .
article_text_summary: we present event - driven simulations of a two - dimensional model of inelastic hard disks confined in a cylinder and subject to a symmetric vibration field at the bottom wall . the model parameters are chosen to match , as closely as possible , those of recent experiments in which buoyancy induced convection was observed .   we show that the model reproduces quantitatively the experimentally observed velocity field and associated structure factor , as well as the density and temperature profiles .   we analyze the effects of a changing the bottom - wall particle coefficient of restitution , and we show that the behavior of the system differs significantly when the bottom wall is `` perfect '' ( i.e . when it is characterized by a coefficient of restitution equal to one ) .   we argue that convection patterns could be used as a test for the validation of models of granular hydrodynamics .   + , u , l , e    * laboratoire de physique mecanique des milieux htroclites ; universit paris vi   ** present address : department of physics and center for materials science and engineering ; massachusetts institute of technology ; cambridge , ma 02139 ; usa   *** laboratoire de physique statistique ; ecole normale suprieure ; 75231 paris cedex 05 ; france   e-mail :   vincent.rey@ens.fr      ,   e , l , e   b   ,   e , l , e   and   ,   e , l , e   are also at this address .   + jrn   ,   e , l , e   is also at laboratoire de physique statistique .

abstract_text: the main inference from the experiments of the 80s that the time - averaged energy spectra of pulsars had to steepen in the gev - tev energy region has been reinforced in the 90s from experiments with higher sensitivities .   however , results from several experiments from the past and the more sensitive experiments at present can be reconciled by invoking a possibly different component arising in the tev region .   the results of the preliminary analysis of the data being collected with the pact array will be presented .
